meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - I'm back at it again with another groovy review for you folks!

Cryptmaster, oh how I adore thee! A game that's equal parts brain-twisting puzzle and linguistic adventure. And let me tell you, it's a real challenge - not just because of the mind-bending riddles, but also because of my own lack of typing skills (I mean, who needs to type fast when you can just use autocorrect, am I right?).

But seriously, Cryptmaster is an indie gem that shines bright with its innovative mechanic and clever storytelling. And I'm not the only one who thinks so - check out what Slant Magazine had to say: "Frustrating as the game may be...". Yeah, I can relate to that frustration - especially when those pesky bug sounds start echoing through the underworld.

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, " Typing? That's not exactly my thing." But trust me, folks, this isn't just about mashing away at your keyboard. It's an experience that requires patience, strategy, and a healthy dose of linguistic flair (or at least, that's what I keep telling myself).

And let's not forget the visuals - oh boy, are they something else! The black-and-white pencil-sketching is a masterclass in atmospheric storytelling, transporting you to a world straight out of a creepy cartoon. Even Softpedia agrees: "World-building is pretty good...".

But don't just take their word for it! I'll let the other critics speak for themselves - like Hardcore Gamer, who praises Cryptmaster's originality and narrative: "The game will challenge your linguistic and typing skills...". Yeah, they're not kidding. This game will put your language skills to the test (or at least, that's what my editor keeps telling me).

In conclusion, Cryptmaster is a real treat for anyone looking for a unique gaming experience. So grab some popcorn, settle in with your favorite typing utensil, and get ready to dive headfirst into an underworld of linguistic lunacy!

(Note: I'll let you guess which critic said this one: "This isn't a type-as-fast-as-you-can first-person-shooter. Thoughtful, patient play drives success...". Yeah, I know, it's a bit of a mouthful!)
